Episode.stage: First scene opens with three Rangers riding through a tunnel, leaving the Wall, and going into the woods. (Eerie music in background) One Ranger splits off and finds a campsite full of mutilated bodies, including a child hanging from a tree branch. A birds-eye view shows the bodies arranged in a shield-like pattern. The Ranger rides back to the other two.

sp.speaker: WAYMAR ROYCE
sp.p: What d’you expect? They’re savages. One lot steals a goat from another lot and before you know it, they’re ripping each other to pieces.

sp.speaker: WILL
sp.p: I’ve never seen wildlings do a thing like this. I’ve never seen a thing like this, not ever in my life.

sp.speaker: WAYMAR ROYCE
sp.p: How close did you get?

sp.speaker: WILL
sp.p: Close as any man would.

sp.speaker: GARED
sp.p: We should head back to the wall.

sp.speaker: ROYCE
sp.p: Do the dead frighten you?

sp.speaker: GARED
sp.p: Our orders were to track the wildlings. We tracked them. They won’t trouble us no more.

sp.speaker: ROYCE
sp.p: You don’t think he’ll ask us how they died? Get back on your horse.

Episode.stage: GARED grumbles.

sp.speaker: WILL
sp.p: Whatever did it to them could do it to us. They even killed the children.

sp.speaker: ROYCE
sp.p: It’s a good thing we’re not children. You want to run away south, run away. Of course, they will behead you as a deserter … If I don’t catch you first. Get back on your horse. I won’t say it again.

Episode.stage: WILL glares, but obeys. Sometime later, the three Rangers return to the campsite, which is now completely cleared.

sp.speaker: ROYCE
sp.p: Your dead men seem to have moved camp.

sp.speaker: WILL
sp.p: They were here.

sp.speaker: GARED
sp.p: See where they went.

Episode.stage: The three look around, swords drawn. They hear the wind and eerie calls. GARED finds a red cloth in the snow.

sp.speaker: ROYCE
sp.p: What is it?

sp.speaker: GARED
sp.p: It’s …

Episode.stage: Blackout

Riders from Winterfell come up behind a dazed WILL. The scene shifts to the castle, where BRAN is practicing archery and getting frustrated, under the eyes of JON SNOW and ROBB STARK. JON pats BRAN’S shoulder.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Go on. Father’s watching.

Episode.stage: We see NED and CATELYN STARK watching from above.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: And your mother.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to needlework practice with the girls inside the castle.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Thank you.

sp.speaker: SEPTA MORDANE
sp.p: I love the detail that you’ve managed to get in this corners. … Quite beautiful … the stitching …

Episode.stage: As she murmurs to SANSA about the embroidery, ARYA struggles with her needlework and listens to the arrows hitting and the male laughter outside.
Outside, BRAN tries and misses again. Everyone laughs.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: And which one of you was a marksman at ten? Keep practicing, Bran. Go on.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Don’t think too much, Bran.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: Relax your bow arm.

Episode.stage: BRAN pulls the arrow back. An arrow hits the bullseye. BRAN (still with his arrow), JON, and ROBB turn in surprise to see ARYA, who curtsies after her perfect shot. ROBB and JON laugh as Bran takes out after ARYA.
RODRICK CASSEL and THEON GREYJOY approach NED and CATELYN on the balcony.

sp.speaker: CASSEL
sp.p: Lord Stark. My lady. A guardsman just rode in from the hills. They’ve captured a deserter from the Night’s Watch.

Episode.stage: NED grimaces.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Get the lads to saddle their horses.

Episode.stage: THEON departs.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Do you have to?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: He swore an oath, Cat.

sp.speaker: CASSEL
sp.p: The law is law, my lady.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Tell Bran he’s coming, too.

Episode.stage: CASSEL nods and departs.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Ned. Ten is too young to see such things.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: He won’t be a boy forever. And winter is coming.

Episode.stage: NED departs. In the courtyard, ROBB and JON gather the arrows. CATELYN turns and glares down on JON. He looks at her and walks away.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: Lad, go run back and get the rest.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts, and we see WILL being taken to the block.
He and NED face each other.

sp.speaker: WILL
sp.p: I know I broke my oath. And I know I’m a deserter. I should have gone back to the Wall and warned them. But I saw what I saw. I saw the White Walkers. People need to know. If you can get word to my family, tell them I’m no coward. Tell them I’m sorry.

Episode.stage: NED bows his head over ICE.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, first of his name …

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Don’t look away.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: King of the Andals and the First Men …

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Father will know if you do.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and protector of the realm, I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.

Episode.stage: NED swings ICE and beheads WILL. BRAN does not look away.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: You did well.

Episode.stage: He walks away. ROBB turns and puts his arm around BRAN and they go to their horses together. NED approaches BRAN.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: You understand why I did it?

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Jon said he was a deserter.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: But do you understand why I had to kill him?

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Our way is the old way?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Is it true he saw the White Walkers?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: The White Walkers have been gone for thousands of years.

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: So he was lying?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: A madman sees what he sees.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to a dead stag’s head. The Winterfell men gather on the bridge They see a ravaged deer before them.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: What is it?

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: Mountain lion?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: There are no mountain lions in these woods.

Episode.stage: With swords out, they begin to search. NED finds a dead direwolf with antlers through her throat. Her pups are whimpering around her.

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: It’s a freak.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: It’s a direwolf.

Episode.stage: NED and CASSEL glance at each other.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Tough old beast.

Episode.stage: He pulls out the antlers.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: There are no direwolves south of the Wall.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Now there are five.

Episode.stage: Jon picks up a pup and offers it to BRAN.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: You want to hold it?

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Where will they go? Their mother’s dead.

sp.speaker: CASSEL
sp.p: They don’t belong down here.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Better a quick death. They won’t last without their mother.

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: Right. Give it here.

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: NO!

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: Put away your blade.

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: I take orders from your father, not you.

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Please, father!

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: I’m sorry, Bran.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Lord Stark? There are five pups. One for each of the Stark children. The direwolf is the sigil of your House. They were meant to have them.

Episode.stage: Everyone looks at NED, BRAN with great hope.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: You will train them yourselves. You will feed them yourselves. And if they die, you will bury them yourselves.

Episode.stage: BRAN cradles his pup as JON hands more pups to ROBB.

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: What about you?

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: I’m not a Stark. Get on.

Episode.stage: JON walks away, pauses, and hears another whimper.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: What is it?

Episode.stage: JON pulls up a white wolf pup.

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: The runt of the litter. That one’s yours, Snow.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to bells ringing at Kings Landing. In front of the Iron Throne, surrounded by druidical looking celebrants, lies the body of JON ARRYN. Up in the balcony, CERSEI watches the scene below as JAIME approaches.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: As your brother, I feel it’s my duty to warn you: You worry too much. It’s starting to show.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: And you never worry about anything. When we were seven, you jumped off the cliffs as Casterly Rock. One hundred foot drop into the water. And you were never afraid.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: There was nothing to be afraid of until you told father. [In a whisper, mimicking] We’re Lannisters. Lannisters don’t act like fools.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: What if Jon Arryn told someone?

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: But who would he tell?

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: My husband.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: If he told the king, both our heads would be skewered on the city gates by now. Whatever Jon Arryn knew or didn’t know, it died with him. And Robert will choose a new Hand of the king, someone to do his job while he’s off fucking boars and hunting whores. Or is it the other way around? And life will go on.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: You should be the Hand of the king.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: That’s an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to a raven approaching Winterfell. CATELYN crosses a busy courtyard and finds NED in the godswood.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: All these years and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: You have five northern children. You’re not an outsider.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I wonder if the old gods agree.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: It’s your gods with all the rules.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I am so sorry, my love.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Tell me.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: There was a raven from Kings Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. A fever took him. I know he was like a father to you.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Your sister. The boy …

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: They both have their health. Gods be good. [pause] The raven brought more news. The king rides for Winterfell. With the queen and all the rest of them.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: He’s coming this far North, there’s only one thing he’s after.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: You can always say no, Ned.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to the Winterfell great hall where a great banquet is being prepared.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: We need plenty of candles for Lord Tyrion’s chamber. I’m told he reads all night.

sp.speaker: MAESTER LUWIN
sp.p: I’m told he drinks all night.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: How much could he possibly drink? A man of his … stature.

sp.speaker: LUWIN
sp.p: We’ve brought up eight barrels of ale from the cellar. Perhaps we’ll find out.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: In any case, candles.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to Robb, Theon, and Jon getting barbered.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Why’s your mother so dead-set on us getting pretty for the king?

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: It’s for the queen, I bet. I hear she’s [sleek as a mink?]

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: I hear the prince is a right royal prick.

sp.speaker: THEON
sp.p: Think of all those southern girls he gets to stab with his right royal prick.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: Go on, Tommy, shave him good. He’s never met a girl he likes better than his own hair.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to the royal procession approaching Winterfell. Bran sees them from his perch high atop a castle wall and clambers nimbly down to tell everyone. CATELYN and LUWIN walk to the courtyard, passing BRAN’s wolf pup.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Gods, but they grow fast. [Seeing BRAN on the wall] Brandon!

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: I saw the king! He’s got hundreds of people!

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: How many times have I told you: No climbing!

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: But he’s coming right now! Down our road!

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I want you to promise me: No more climbing.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: D’you know what?

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: What?

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: You always look at your feet before you lie. Run and find your father. Tell him the king is close.

Episode.stage: BRAN runs off, followed by his wolf pup.

Scene shifts to grand entry of the king’s horses and men. ARYA, wearing a helm and cloak, pushes her way into a tall wagon for a better look. In rides JOFFREY, followed by the HOUND. The other Starks wait in a greeting line.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Where’s Arya? Sansa, where’s your sister?

Episode.stage: More riders with banners. ARYA scoots past her parents to get in the receiving line.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Hey,, hey, hey, hey. What are you doing with that on? [Pulls off ARYA’s helm]

Episode.stage: JOFFREY rides up, SANSA smiles at him, ROBB glares at JOFFREY. The HOUND pulls up his helm. The coach carrying CERSEI lumbers in, followed by KING ROBERT. All kneel. ROBERT heaves himself off his horse. NED looks shocked at the sight of his old friend, now fat and red-faced. ROBERT signals for all to rise and looks at NED.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Your Grace.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: You’ve got fat.

Episode.stage: NED gives ROBERT a “What about you?” look. They start laughing.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Cat!

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Your Grace.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Nine years. Why haven’t I seen you? Where the hell have you been?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Guarding the North for you, Your Grace. Winterfell is yours.

Episode.stage: CERSEI and her other children descend from the coach.

sp.speaker: ARYA
sp.p: Where’s the Imp?

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Will you shut up?

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Who have we here? You must be Robb. (To Sansa) My, you’re a pretty one. (To Arya) Your name is?

sp.speaker: ARYA
sp.p: Arya.

Episode.stage: JAIME removes his helm.

sp.speaker: ARYA
sp.p: That’s Jaime Lannister. The queen’s twin brother.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Would you please shut up.

Episode.stage: CERSEI approaches.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: My queen.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: My queen.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Take me to your crypt. I want to pay my respects.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: We’ve been riding for a month, my love. Surely the dead can wait.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Ned.

sp.speaker: ARYA
sp.p: Where’s the Imp?

Episode.stage: CERSEI, humiliated in front of all, walks back to JAIME.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: Where is our brother? Go find the little beast.

Episode.stage: Scene changes to the crypt.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Tell me about Jon Arryn.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: One minute he was fine, and then … Burned right through him, whatever it was. I loved that man.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: We both did.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: He never had to teach you much, but me … You remember me at 16? All I wanted to do was crack skulls and fuck girls. He showed me what was what.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Aye.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Don’t look at me like that. Not his fault I didn’t listen. (They laugh. ROBERT sighs.) I need you, Ned. Down at Kings Landing. Not up here, where you’re no damn use to anybody. Lord Eddard Stark, I would name you the Hand of the king.

Episode.stage: NED kneels.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: I’m not worthy of the honor.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: I’m not trying to honor you. I’m trying to get you to run my kingdom while I eat, drink, and whore my way to an early grave. Damn it, Ned, stand up. You helped me win the Iron Throne, now help me keep the damn thing. We were meant to rule together. If your sister had lived, we would have been bound by blood. Well, it’s not too late. I have a son, you have a daughter. We’ll join our Houses.

Episode.stage: Scene changes to JAIME in the Winterfell settlement. We see Tyrion inside a whorehouse, swilling liquor and laughing as a woman pops into view after servicing him.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Mmh. It is true what they say about the Northern girls.

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: Did you hear the king’s in Winterfell?

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: I did hear something about that.

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: And the queen. And her twin brother. They say that he is the most handsome man in the Seven Kingdoms.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: And the other brother?

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: The queen has two brothers?

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: There’s the pretty one. And there’s the clever one.

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: I hear they call him the Imp.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: I hear he hates that nickname.

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: Oh? I hear he’s more than earned it. I hear he’s a drunken little lecher into all manner of perversions.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Clever girl.

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: We’ve been expecting you, Lord Tyrion.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Have you?

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: The gods gave me one blessing.

Episode.stage: She climbs on TYRION. JAIME walks in without knocking.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: Don’t get up.

sp.speaker: ROS
sp.p: M’lord.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Should I explain to you the meaning of a closed door in a whorehouse, brother?

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: You’ve much to teach me, no doubt. But our sister craves your attention.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: She has odd cravings, our sister.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: A family trait. Now, the Starks are feasting us at sundown. Don’t leave me alone with these people.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: I’m sorry, I’ve begun the feast a bit early. And this is the first of many courses.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: I thought you might say that. But since we’re short on time, (he opens the door; a bevy of whores enter and descend on TYRION) Come on, girls. See you at sundown.

Episode.stage: JAIME leaves.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Close the door!

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Did you have to bury her in a place like this? She should be on a hill somewhere with the sun and the clouds above her.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: She was my sister. This is where she belongs.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: She belonged with me.

Episode.stage: He touches Lyanna’s face.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: In my dreams, I kill him every night.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: It’s done, Your Grace. The Targaryens are gone.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Not all of them.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to Daenerys on a balcony in Pentos, across the Narrow Sea.
He enters a large chamber.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Daenerys! There’s our bride to be! Look – a gift from Illyrio. Touch it. Come on. Feel the fabric. Mmmm. Isn’t he a gracious host?

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: We’ve been his guests for over a year and he’s never asked us for anything.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Illyrio is no fool. He knows I won’t forget my friends when I come into my throne. You still slouch. Let me see. (He pulls off her gown.) You have a woman’s body now. (She endures it as he strokes her breast.) I need you to be perfect today. Can you do that for me? You don’t want to wake the dragon, do you?

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: No.

Episode.stage: VISERYS nods and starts to leave the chamber. He turns.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: When they write the history of my reign, sweet sister, they will say it began today.

Episode.stage: Daenerys turns and steps into a steaming hot bath with a despairing look on her face.

sp.speaker: MAID
sp.p: It’s too hot, my lady.

Episode.stage: But DAENERYS keeps stepping deeper. The scene shifts to ILLYRIOS, DAENERYS, AND VISERYS outside the mansion, awaiting Khal Drogo.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Where is he?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: The Dothraki are not known for their punctuality.

Episode.stage: A host of Dothraki come riding up. Khal Drogo wheels his stallion into the front.

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: (Greets them in Dothraki.) May I present my honored guests? Viserys of House Targaryen, the third of his name. The rightful King of the Andals and the First Men. And his sister, Daenerys, of the House Targaryen.

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: Come forward, my dear.

Episode.stage: KHAL DROGO watches as DAENERYS walks toward him. She does not hesitate and looks straight at him, although there is fear on her face. KHAL DROGO gazes at her and then leads his horsemen on a charge away.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Where’s he going?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: The ceremony is over.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: But he didn’t say anything. Did he like her?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: Trust me, Your Grace. If he didn’t like her, we’d know.

Episode.stage: The scene shifts to ILLYRIO, VISERYS, AND DAENERYS ON A GARDEN BALCONY OVERLOOKING THE SEA.

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: It won’t be long now. Soon you will cross the Narrow Sea and take back your father’s throne. The people drink secret toasts to your health. They cry out for their true king.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: When will they be married?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: Soon. The Dothraki never stay still for long.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Is it true they lie with their horses?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: I wouldn’t ask Khal Drogo.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Do you take me for a fool?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: I take you for a king. Kings lack the caution of common men. My apologies if I’ve given offense.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: I know how to play a man like Drogo. I give him a queen and he gives me an army.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: So do I. I want us both to go home. But they took it from us. So tell me, sweet sister, how do we go home?

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: I don’t know.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: We go home with an army. With Khal Drogo’s army. I would let his whole tribe fuck you, all 40,000 men and their horses too, if that’s what it took.

Episode.stage: He gives DAENERYS a brotherly kiss on the forehead and walks away. The scene shifts to a bedroom in Winterfell, where CATELYN is fixing SANSA’S hair.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Do you think Joffrey will like me? What if he thinks I’m ugly?

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Then he is the stupidest prince that ever lived.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: He’s so handsome.

Episode.stage: CATELYN rolls her eyes.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: When would we be married? Soon or do we have to wait?

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Hush now. Your father hasn’t even said yes.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Why would he say no? He’d be the second most powerful man in the kingdoms.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: He’d have to leave home. He’d have to leave me. And so would you.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: You left your home to come here. And I’d be queen someday. Please make father say yes.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Sansa…

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Please, please. It’s the only thing I ever wanted.

Episode.stage: Scene shifts to the Winterfell banquet. Laughter, music, KING ROBERT getting bawdy with a wench. CATELYN and CERSEI watch, CATELYN embarrassed for CERSEI, who looks disgusted. Out in the courtyard, JON takes out his frustration on a fencing dummy. His uncle BENJEN rides up.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: Is he dead yet?

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Uncle Benjen!

Episode.stage: They hug.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: You got bigger. I rode all day. Didn’t want to leave you alone with the Lannisters. Why aren’t you at the feast?

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Lady Stark thought it might insult the royal family to seat a bastard in their midst.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: Well, you’re always welcome on the wall. No bastard was ever refused a seat there.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: So take me with you when you go back.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: Jon…

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Father will let me if you ask him, I know he will.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: The Wall isn’t going anywhere.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: I’m ready to swear your oath.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: You don’t understand what you’d be giving up. We have no families. None of us will ever father sons.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: I don’t care about that.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: You might, if you knew what it meant. … I’d better get inside. Rescue your father from his guests. We’ll talk later.

Episode.stage: BENJEN goes to the banquet.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Your uncle’s in the Night’s Watch.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: What’re you doing back there?

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: You’re Tyrion Lannister. The queen’s brother?

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: My greatest accomplishment. You – you’re Ned Stark’s bastard, aren’t you?

Episode.stage: JON looks angry and turns away.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: Did I offend you? Sorry. You are the bastard, though.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: Lord Eddard Stark is my father.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: And Lady Stark is not your mother. Making you a bastard. Let me give you some advice, bastard. Never forget what you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armor. Then it can never be used to hurt you.

sp.speaker: JON
sp.p: What the hell do you know about being a bastard?

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: All dwarves are bastards in their fathers’ eyes.

Episode.stage: TYRION departs. JON picks up his sword and attacks the dummy with new ferocity.
The scene shifts back to the banquet, in full raucous swing. NED is off to himself; BENJEN comes up to him.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: You at a feast -- It’s like a bear in a trap.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: The boy I beheaded. Did you know him?

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: Of course I did. Just a lad. But he was tough, Ned. A true Ranger.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: He was talking madness. Said the Walkers slaughtered his friends.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: The two he was with are still missing.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: A wildling ambush.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: Maybe. Direwolves south of the wall. Talk of the Walkers. My brother might be the next Hand to the king. Winter is coming.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Winter is coming.

Episode.stage: ROBB approaches.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: Uncle Benjen.

sp.speaker: BENJEN
sp.p: Robb boy. How are ye?

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: I’m good.

Episode.stage: KING ROBERT gets even more bawdy with a wench.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: Yes. Lovely country.

Episode.stage: They observe SANSA.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I’m sure it’s very grim, after Kings Landing. I remember how scared I was when Ned brought me up here for the first time.

Episode.stage: SANSA approaches and smiles shyly at CERSEI.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: Hello, little dove. But you are a beauty. How old are you?

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Thirteen, Your Grace.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: You’re tall. Still growing?

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: I think so, Your Grace.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: And have you bled yet?

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: And your dress. Did you make it?

Episode.stage: SANSA nods yes.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: Such talent. You must make something for me.

Episode.stage: SANSA departs.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: I hear we might share a grandchild someday.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I hear the same.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: Your daughter will do well in the capital. Such a beauty shouldn’t stay hidden up here forever.

Episode.stage: SANSA and JOFFREY catch each other’s eye. JOFFREY smiles at her and she turns to her friend.
JAIME and NED meet up. JAIME blocks their path.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Your pardon.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: I hear we might be neighbors soon. I hope it’s true.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Yes, the king has honored me with his offer.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: I’m sure we’ll have a tournament to celebrate the new title, if you accept. It would be good to have you in the field. The competition has become a bit stale.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: I don’t fight in tournaments.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: No? Getting a little old for it?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: I don’t fight in tournaments because when I fight a man for real, I don’t want him to know what I can do.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: Well said.

Episode.stage: ARYA flips food onto SANSA’s face.

sp.speaker: SANSA
sp.p: Arya!

Episode.stage: CATELYN signals a laughing ROBB to deal with the girls. He hoists up ARYA.

sp.speaker: ROBB
sp.p: Time for bed.

Episode.stage: The scene shifts to after the banquet. NED and CATELYN are in their bed.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: I’m a Northman. I belong here with you, not down south in that rat’s nest they call a capital.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I won’t let him take you.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: The king takes what he wants. That’s why he’s king.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: I’ll say, ‘Listen, fat man, you are not taking my husband anywhere. He belongs to me now.’

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: How did he get so fat?

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: He only stops eating when it’s time for a drink.

Episode.stage: There’s a knock at the door.

sp.speaker: A VOICE
sp.p: It’s Maester Luwin, my lord.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Send him in.

sp.speaker: LUWIN
sp.p: Pardon, my lord, my lady. A rider in the night from your sister.

Episode.stage: He hands CATELYN a sealed note.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: Stay.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: This was sent from the Eyrie. What’s she doing at the Eyrie? She hasn’t been back there since her wedding.

Episode.stage: CATELYN reads the note, looks up in alarm, and then burns it.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: What news?

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: She’s fled the capital. She says Jon Arryn was murdered. By the Lannisters. She says the king is in danger.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: She’s fresh widowed, Cat. She doesn’t know what she’s saying.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: Lysa’s head would be on a spike right now if the wrong people had found that letter. Do you think she would risk her life, her son’s life, if she wasn’t certain her husband was murdered?

sp.speaker: LUWIN
sp.p: If this news is true, and the Lannisters conspire against the throne, who but you can protect the king?

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: They murdered the last Hand. Now you want Ned to take the job.

sp.speaker: LUWIN
sp.p: The king rode for a month to ask Lord Stark’s help. He’s the only one he trusts. You swore the king an oath, my lord.

sp.speaker: CATELYN
sp.p: He spent half his life fighting Robert’s wars. He owes him nothing. (To NED) Your father and brother rode south once on a king’s demand.

sp.speaker: LUWIN
sp.p: A different time. Different king.

Episode.stage: The scene shifts to the wild wedding celebration of KHAL DROGO and DAENERYS. Fighting and fornication. DAENERYS looks stricken at everything around her.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: When do I meet with the Khal? We need to begin planning the invasion.

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: If Khal Drogo has promised you a crown, you shall have it.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: When?

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: When their omens favor war.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: I piss on Dothraki omens. I waited 17 years to get my throne back.

Episode.stage: The sex and violence intensify. Two men fight to the death over a woman each is trying to rape. KHAL DROGO watches avidly.

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: A Dothraki wedding without at least three deaths is considered a dull affair.

Episode.stage: A knight in Westerosi garb appears. KHAL DROGO greets him in Dothraki. It is JORAH MORMONT, bearing books.

sp.speaker: JORAH
sp.p: A small gift for the new Khaleesi. Songs and histories from the Seven Kingdoms.

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: Thank you, ser. Are you from my country?

sp.speaker: JORAH
sp.p: Ser Jorah Mormont of Bear Island. I served your father for many years. Gods be good, I hope to always serve the rightful king.

Episode.stage: DANY is presented with a chest with three dragon eggs in it.

sp.speaker: ILLYRIO
sp.p: Dragons’ eggs, Daenerys. From the Shadow Lands beyond Asshai. The ages have turned them to stone, but they will always be beautiful.

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: Thank you, Magister.

Episode.stage: KHAL DROGO rises and strides forward. DAENERYS follows him, looking sick with fear. The Dothraki crowd behind her as she goes. The KHAL leads her to a white mare.

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: She’s beautiful. … Ser Jorah, I don’t know how to say ‘thank you’ in Dothraki.

sp.speaker: JORAH
sp.p: There is no word for ‘thank you’ in Dothraki.

Episode.stage: The KHAL puts DANY on her horse and mounts his.

sp.speaker: VISERYS
sp.p: Make him happy.

Episode.stage: The scene shifts to the seaside at sunset. The KHAL begins to unwrap DANY’s dress. She is sobbing. He touches the tears on her face.

sp.speaker: KHAL DROGO
sp.p: No.

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: Do you know the Common Tongue?

sp.speaker: KHAL DROGO
sp.p: No.

sp.speaker: DAENERYS
sp.p: Is ‘no’ the only word that you know?

sp.speaker: KHAL DROGO
sp.p: No.

Episode.stage: He takes off her gown and bends her down.
The scene shifts to Winterfell. Tyrion and the Hound are seated outside the day after the banquet.

sp.speaker: THE HOUND
sp.p: Rough night, Imp?

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: If I get through this without squirting from one end or the other, it will be a miracle.

sp.speaker: THE HOUND
sp.p: I didn’t pick you for a hunter.

sp.speaker: TYRION
sp.p: The greatest in the land. My spear never misses.

sp.speaker: THE HOUND
sp.p: It’s not hunting if you pay for it.

Episode.stage: The king and Ned come into view.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: Are you as good with a spear as you used to be?

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: No, but I’m still better than you.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: I know what I’m putting you through. Thank you for saying yes. I only ask you because I need you. You’re a loyal friend. You hear me? A loyal friend. The last one I’ve got.

sp.speaker: NED
sp.p: I hope I’ll serve you well.

sp.speaker: ROBERT
sp.p: You will. And I’ll make sure you don’t look so fucking grim all the time. Come on, boys, let’s go kill some boar!

Episode.stage: The king’s party rides off, NED nodding goodbye to BRAN, whose wolf pup begins sniffing at his feet.

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Come on, you.

Episode.stage: BRAN begins climbing, his wolf pup crying at the bottom of the castle wall. As he nears the top, he hears a woman and man moaning. Peering in the window, he sees CERSEI and JAIME having sex. CERSEI sees BRAN.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: Stop. STOP.

Episode.stage: JAIME runs and grabs BRAN at the window.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: Are you completely mad?

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: He saw us.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: It’s all right. It’s all right.

sp.speaker: CERSEI
sp.p: He saw us!

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: I heard you the first time. (To BRAN) Quite the little climber, aren’t you? How old are you, boy?

sp.speaker: BRAN
sp.p: Ten

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: Ten.

Episode.stage: JAIME looks at CERSEI, who gazes back imploringly.

sp.speaker: JAIME
sp.p: The things I do for love.

Episode.stage: He shoves BRAN out the window.
